comments.commentBody:
Martin, in my frustration I looked up mercury in connection with alchemy. The wiki article on mercury has this to say: "Mercury is the only metal for which the alchemical planetary name became the common name." I don't believe azoth was mentioned.

Now's your chance to be a wiki editor.
Easy.  Use a word ladder.  :-)

Dr W,

"Azoth" was not the alchemical planetary name. Mercury had many names. Azoth was it's arcane name, stressing the infinity of nature. It was also called by a term from the kaballah, ayn sof, אין סוף, which meant the same thing.

The planetary name stressed its "quickness," which is still conveyed by the terms quicksilver and "mercurial." The alchemists were the best and brightest of their day, and lacking a lot of actual knowledge, expounded quite Talmudically.

"Azoth" is a veritable onion to peel. It's the name for mercury from alchemy, but it has mystical connotations as the force of transmutation (which is different from transcription). The name is a portmanteau of A (Latin A, Greek Alpha and Hebrew Aleph united), Z (final Latin letter), O (for Omega) and Th (for Hebrew Tav).

It was used by the first western alchemist, Mary the Jewess, who lived in the first, second or third century. We're not sure when she lived, or if she really lived at all, although she is written OF a great deal throughout the Middle Ages. A lot of philosophical, kabbalistic ideas are attributed to her.
The alchemists' Axiom of Maria is "One becomes two, two becomes three, and out of the third comes the one as the fourth." I have no idea what that means, but philosophers through Jung have been trying to explain to for almost two thousand years. Compared to that, "azoth" is a piece of cake.

Mary is also credited with the invention of a number of devices used by alchemists, including a sort of alembic still used by chemists. Another invention is a device to limit the heating of a vessel to the boiling point of another liquid. This device is still used in labs and in kitchens, where it carries her name: the bain-marie.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_the_Jewess
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Axiom_of_Maria

I don't know why some people treat the appearance of a wonderful word like "azoth" in a puzzle with such derision

The American government's goal is to divide all strong countries in the Middle East into small federations that won't be able to stand up to U.S. corporations. See the "New Middle East" drawn up by Condoleeza Rice and George Bush, Jr. The U.S. has been trying to re-make the Middle East to match this map--and it is getting scary close. Let countries in the Middle East elect who they want (i.e. Assad & Gaddafi)--leave them their oil. U.S. out now.

Face it, our best bet for reducing the violence, elimnating ISIS, and stemming the destabilizing flow of refugees into other countries involves working with Assad at least in the near term.

Supporting the moderate or other groups using violence against the Assad regime has added to the chaos and problems. The moderate groups we back could never have won.

Future historians can judge our actions from the start down this slippery slope from the start of the rebellion until now. Was our motive to support democratic values against a tyrannical regime? Or was it to set up our own base of influence?

It's probably not possible to keep Syria together as much more than a federation of regions based on ethnic and religion, but perhaps with some more diverse areas such as Aleppo and Damascus.

I don't know if the Russian efforts will succeed, but they are the only bet I'd put money on now.

What's not to like? Did you read? Russia is bombing moderate anti-Assad rebels. We support these groups because Assad is a ruthless butcher who massacred thousands of his own people. The moderates are what Assad fear most because they are the long term threat his rule. If Assad stays you see more instability in the middle east.

Ever hear of a proxy war? Well guess what, it just started.

Russia isn't bombing ISIS. Russia is bombing the moderate rebel forces against Assad because they are a long term threat to him. Assad is smiling now because he has both ISIS and Russia doing his dirty work. Assad is a tyrant, terrorist, and a butcher. If he stays in power the middle east will be worse off.

Also, now that Russia has entered the picture, guess what. This will draw even more fundamentalists into Syria. Assad was right in one respect. He said the middle east burn and it surely has. And things will get even worse with a Russia in the mix.
The "problem" you refer to has been ongoing for several centuries, it won't go away anytime soon.
The resemblance to Armageddon is striking.

Dukas was so self-critical that any work making it to publication counts as a highlight of his oeuvre. As for recordings, I enjoy Slatkin's disc of the orchestral music, and Hamelin's recording of the piano sonata.

Some enterprising opera company should consider putting on both Dukas' and Bartok's Bluebeard operas in the same season...
MTF, I wouldn't think it but you must have be squeezing the water bag tonight.

Loved this recipe! Will definitely make this again. Didn't have any jalepenos so used a teaspoon of red chile flakes and doubled the recipe to feed 4 adults. I didn't make any other changes to the recipe. I used two very large navel oranges and loved the flavours combined with ginger and garlic.
Isn't it possible that using red wine, garlic and whole milk is the reason why you found this dish to not be great? It seems like you made an entirely different dish than what the recipe is for.
This is a classic Roman recipe from 1960's Rome...La Dolce Vita...Via Veneto...paparazzi...nothing was boring then...

Fine but not great. Used minced garlic and fresh tomatoes, with red wine to make up for the can juices. I didn't have cream so used I whole milk... maybe that was the missing element? Per others' notes, I doubled the sauce:pasta ratio as well as the simmering time, and hit it with the immersion blender mid-reduction.

I've never had this dish before, so I have nothing to compare it to, but... meh. I tend to think of 60s-era food as a little boring; this recipe only reinforced that opinion.

"At least one and possibly more Syrian opposition groups that have been secretly armed and trained by the C.I.A. were among the rebel groups targeted by the Russian airstrikes, a senior United States official said."

CIA's covert coup d'etat in Syria has contributed to millions of Syrian refugees and internal displacement. In yesterday's committee hearing on Syrian Refugees, Senators made a mockery of the subject by using it as an opportunity to attack Obama and parrot their pro-Israel stance.

US didn't give a damn about Iraqi Christians and other minorities when it started an occupation to overthrow Saddam. It made no plans to rescue them, no attempt to give them secure passage. If you don't care about the millions of Muslim lives you destroy, at least show the decency to care about the millions of Christians who lost all their assets, livelihood and became refugees if not killed.

Then came Syria and Libya. The Clean Break to destabilize any and all governments that doesn't have a CIA picked puppet who plays nice with Israel.

Regardless of lack of Putin's ethical behavior, if Russian participation eventually helps to beat and eliminate ISIS, it's quite good. In this muddled situation, everything can't go according to logical planning.

For now Assad may have to be retained.

If president Obama hadn't said Assad should go, or not ANNOUNCED his "redline," things wouldn't have been this bad. He would be criticized for his inaction; that's that. His involvement in Libya and advocating the ouster of Mubarak in Egypt didn't turn out too well.

True, all these problems wouldn't be there if George W Bush & the neocons were more restrained and hadn't invaded Iraq. But once that happened we, including Bush's successors owned Iraq.

Bush was too disengaged to dump Maliki. Obama should have realized Maliki's discrimination against the Shias & he should have restrained Maliki. He should have sternly warned Maliki in 2009 and one way or another threatened to put a moderate Shia in his place. But that didn't happen. ISIS grew far out of any one's expectations.

When I say ISIS is the new Nazis, few accept it. Without being so, how can you explain the 30K foreign fighters, including 250 Americans joining ISIS? I FEEL it's Al-Baghdadi's charisma that is making ISIS such a magnet to young foreign Muslims, not their savvy online propaganda. Back in 1930s Queen Elizabeth & the Queen mother clearly displayed the Nazi salute! Hitler was that influential then.
To me, anybody fighting ISIS is a friend.
ISIS was not created by Russia but by Turkey, the Gulf States and the CIA and its networks of operatives and mercenaries.
I disagree.  If Assad falls, all of Syria will descend into chaos, and there will be a bloodbath and ISIS takes over.  Then you will see a real flood of refugees.

America get as far away from the middle east as fast as you possibly can or very soon it's unravelling shall be your be unravelling.
Yours truly,
Sanity

Then you go fight and take your own kids and your own money.  Don't you take mine.    There are many of us who are opposed to more involvement and want to stop being the world police.  It's not weakness or pathetic.  You wishing to take more of our kids and money to throw to the ME mess is pathetic.

The CIA-trained jihadists in Syria are just a cynical front. It's how American weapons get delivered to ISIS without implicating Washington.

Everybody knows that there are no moderate Sunni fundamentalist jihadists in this or any other planet in the Multiverse. They're all the same bunch of Medieval troglodytes out to murder infidels, enslave women, and destroy priceless pre-Islamic cultural treasures.

There’s only one sensible thing to do with such people, and Putin will do it.

According to earlier reporting, there is little threat of anti-aircraft fire in the areas where US aircraft are operating.[1] That may or may not apply to the areas where the Russians are operating.

[1] '“Quite honestly, the U.S. Air Force, Navy and Marines own the skies,” said Maj. Anthony Bourke, a former Air Force fighter pilot. “So even though pilots dream of dogfights, the biggest risk now is small-arms fire, and if you stay above 10,000 feet, you’re not going to be hit.”'

For U.S. Pilots, the Real War on ISIS Is a Far Cry From ‘Top Gun’
By HELENE COOPER
SEPT. 16, 2015
http://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/17/world/middleeast/for-us-pilots-the-rea...
Wouldn't it be unfortunate if a Russian fighter was downed by a "terrorist" fired SAM?  Welcome to the fight Mr. Putin.
Why does the West insist on removing Assad from Syria? What good did it bring removing Saddam and Gaddafi from Iraq and Lybia respectively. Are those countries and their people better off today?
According to Fox this is how WW3 will start. I'll put my money on Putin, they'll be out of there in 2 years with Assad back in complete power.

Did you not read the article, the Russians did not strike ISIS. And by the way Joseph Stalin was negaotiating with Hitler in 1939 not trying to strangle him. You should take a look at the Molotov Ribbentrop Pact where they secretly agreed to carve up parts of eastern Europe.
Didn't you read the article? He didn't attach ISIS
You can pack up your JV team Barrack...the varsity team just showed up.
No we don't.  The adults are all dead and gone.

According to the article[1], the Pentagon-trained fighters are now essentially non-existent, while the CIA-trained fighters number around "3,000 to 5,000". Given that the CIA program is "covert", that estimate is highly suspect. The Times didn't even cite a source for the "3,000 to 5,000" estimate.

[1] 'While the Pentagon’s $500 million program to train and equip Syrian fighters has largely failed — at one point this month only four or five American-trained combatants were in the fight in Syria — the C.I.A.’s covert program to train other fighters has weathered some setbacks to produce 3,000 to 5,000 fighters in the nearly two years it has been operating.'

So I can understand this, is the group trained by the CIA that one lone person we were talking about? Also, the CIA are training moderate Muslims? Are these the same people that trained the 'moderate' OBL back in the 80's.

For God's sake America, do you know what you are doing!!
